DOC.brief_summary: The Advance® 18 PTX® Balloon Catheter study is a clinical trial to study the safety and effectiveness of the Advance 18® PTX® Balloon Catheter in the treatment of lesions in the superficial femoral artery and popliteal artery.
DOC.criteria: Key Age >18 years. Able to provide informed consent. Has at least one de novo or restenotic lesion(s) with > 70% stenosis documented angiographically of the SFA or popliteal artery. If more than one lesion requires intervention, only one should be treated as a study lesion. Key Has significant stenosis (> 50%) or occlusion of inflow tract (proximal ipsilateral, iliofemoral, or aortic lesions) not successfully treated before this procedure. Lack of at least one patent runoff vessel with < 50% stenosis throughout its course. Lesions in target area requiring atherectomy (or ablative devices), cutting balloons, cryoplasty balloons, or any other advanced device to facilitate angioplasty balloon or stent delivery.
